content.webTitle: Mother of Leicester winger Marc Albrighton’s partner killed in Tunisia massacre

fields.headline: Mother of Leicester winger Marc Albrighton’s partner killed in Tunisia massacre
fields.bodyText: Leicester City have offered their condolences after learning that the mother of Marc Albrighton’s partner, Chloe, was killed during the beach attacks in Tunisia. Sue Davey was confirmed as one of the victims in Friday’s attack, along with her partner Scott Chalkley. The Premier League club released a statement on their website offering support to the devastated family. The statement read: “Leicester City Football Club offers its sincerest condolences to Marc Albrighton, his partner Chloe and their family, after learning of the deaths of Chloe’s mother, Sue, and her partner, Scott, during Friday’s attacks in Tunisia. They are all in our thoughts and prayers. “We continue to offer our support to Marc and Chloe’s family at this time of great personal tragedy.” Ms Davey’s son Conor Fulford, who had launched a social-media appeal for information regarding his mother, posted: “Thank you for willing me and my family on but unfortunately we lost the battle to keep my mom in our lives but don’t worry mom, I’m there and so is Daren Fulford to look after our two girls Chloe Lea Fulford and Rosy Fulford and all of our family. Love you forever.” Mr Chalkley’s son Ross Naylor confirmed his father’s death via Twitter. He posted: “Tonight, me and Brad lost our dad. Unfortunately, he was caught up in the sickening attacks in Tunisia and is no longer with us. I feel I had to put this message out as many of you have been asking about him and asking for an update. I’m sure many of you have seen the news about Sue as well, so all I ask is that people let both families grief in peace. We are all trying to come to grips and process with what’s happened. I want to say thanks to everyone who has helped. You have all been amazing. One love to all. Rest in peace dad.” Albrighton, a former Aston Villa winger, made 20 appearances for Leicester last season, scoring twice.
